title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, exploring racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance, where individual freedom is suppressed.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A critique of the American Dream, this novel follows Jay Gatsby's pursuit of wealth and love in the Roaring Twenties.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A romantic novel that explores the societal pressures and romantic entanglements of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A coming-of-age story that delves into teenage angst and rebellion through the perspective of Holden Caulfield.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an epic adventure with dwarves to reclaim their treasure from the dragon Smaug.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A philosophical novel following Santiago, a shepherd, on his journey to find treasure and discover his personal legend.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: Harry discovers he's a wizard and begins his magical education at Hogwarts, uncovering the truth about his parents' deaths.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
summary: A post-apocalyptic tale of a father and son journeying through a desolate world, clinging to their humanity.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
summary: Set in Nazi Germany, this novel follows young Liesel Meminger as she discovers the power of words and books during wartime.
